course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Biological Psychology
course.description: This course provides an introduction to the biological approach to psychology. Comparative studies on non-human animals and the issue of genetic inheritance of behavior will be discussed. Emphasis will be placed on key principles of human nervous system function and how they are reflected in human thoughts and behavior. Key topics covered include the organization of the brain, the visual system, how learning and memory occur in the brain, and the cognitive and behavioral consequences of brain injury and disease.
course.prerequisites: SOSC 1960 OR SOSC 1980

reviews.comment_teaching: He teach quite clear but a bit fast for me as I have no biology background.
reviews.comment_grading:
The quiz mean is quite high as the quizzes are open book and all MC questions. The final grade is not yet released.
Quiz 1: mean 31.13/50
Quiz 2: mean 43.09/50

The overall presentation score is also high. He gave us all a good mark.
Mean :21/25
Lowest: 19/25
Highest: 23/25

The group formation presentation is randomly assigned so it really depends on your luck to meet good groupmates.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is two assignment after tutorials and the word limit is around 300 so it is not too difficult and time-consuming to complete the assignment.
Two quizzes (or called MT and exam)  The final exam is before the exam periood.
Group Presentation
Individual Report after presentation (you need to cover extension of the presentation which are something not included in the presentation ) The word limit is 1000.

reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Nicolson Siu was a new lecturer differing this course at that time, he will cater for the beginner to slow down his teaching speed, so it is friendly for bio beginners. However, you may find it boring if you have biological foundations.
reviews.comment_grading: a bad grade, if you wish to learn basic biology, then you can go but prepare for the bad result although as you may need to compete with bioengineering geh students

quite low

reviews.comment_teaching:
first of all, it is important to note that Maria's accent is really really difficult to understand ðŸ˜‚ So it is lucky that I take this course during the "zoom period". With the help of zoom subtitle, it is a little bit easier for me to understand what she is saying as you can reloop and slow down the lecture video. So if you need to take this lecture during the face-to-face mode, pls think twiceðŸ˜‰. As her lecture content is not perfectly equal to the textbook content, you must attend her lecture to learn.

Back to the main point, I think Maria's teaching is good and fine?! Apart from her accent issue, she is very willing to answer students' questions and listen to our opinion. For instance, right after the midterm, some students stated that she is teaching too fast and she immediately slow down the teaching speed after the midterm. For me, as a student without any biological background really can feel the difference.
Also, she is willing to answer questions either in person or through email. ps. i normally email her at the end of every topic (I summarize questions that I hv for every topic), she answers my email quite fast and with proper explanation.

However, it is important to note that you only register this course if you are really interested in biological psychology and do not hate biology thing. As this course is really really about biology. If you hate it, it would definitely be torture studying this course. If you are not very interested in biological psychology, pls make sure that you have a biology background, so that you can study this course easily.
reviews.comment_grading:
Better than I expected. I got an A with a total score < 90% (approximately 86?! ).
I get the 1st quiz score below mean and still get an A. So I would say that the grading is good?!

btw, I think that if this course open again, the quiz would be less difficult. As it is a new course, Maria seems still discovering ways to "test" students. As the first quiz, most of us did not have a good performance and thought that it was too difficult. So I feel that the level of difficulty of 2nd quiz dropped significantly. (however, it is just my personal feeling. it just for reference)

Tutorial assignments (15% x 2). Maximum 500 words each
Assignment 1 - Mean 11, SD 2
Assignment 2-  Mean 9.74, SD 3.58

Essay (30%). Maximum 1,500 words.
Mean 22.11, SD 7.35.

Group presentation (10%). Paired with another classmate, present about the similarities and differences in our 1500 essays
Mean 8.1, SD 1.81.

Quizzes (10% + 20%). The first quiz in True/ False format (10%) and the second quiz in the form of short-essay questions (20%).
Quiz 1 - Mean 6.2, SD 1.04
Quiz 2 - Mean 12.02, SD 4.35
reviews.comment_workload:
I think is fine?!
thought there are two small assignment, but they are both just 500 words each. But if you aim to get high score, you definitely need to read papers to take reference.
Especially, for the essay section, though she just requires minium 4 paper reference. However, if you need to get high mark, you need to read more and cite more.
This course I would say that the more effort you put, the higher mark you get. As this sem, it seems there is not much "god people" bringing up the mean.  If you study more, you definitely get a good score ðŸ˜‰

reviews.comment_teaching:
I personally like Maria's teaching and think the content covered in each lecture is appropriate, but this may due to my life science background ;-/ For those without lifs background, her teaching might be a bit too fast, so after a mid-semester survey she adjusted it and slow down.

She also adds some cool examples (e.g. typing using brain waves), and her PPT is quite clear with some fun celebrity/kitten memes ;)
reviews.comment_grading:
Better than I expected.`

Tutorial assignments (15% x 2). Maximum 500 words each
Assignment 1 - Mean 11, SD 2
Assignment 2-  Mean 9.74, SD 3.58

Essay (30%). Maximum 1,500 words.
Mean 22.11, SD 7.35.

Group presentation (10%). Paired with another classmate, present about the similarities and differences in our 1500 essays
Mean 8.1, SD 1.81.

Quizzes (10% + 20%). The first quiz in True/ False format (10%) and the second quiz in the form of short-essay questions (20%).
Quiz 1 - Mean 6.2, SD 1.04
Quiz 2 - Mean 12.02, SD 4.35

Because the SD is quite high, and most of my scores are higher than mean for less than 1 SD, I was expecting sth around A-. But turned out to be an A+!
reviews.comment_workload:
I have to say the workload is even larger than some of my 3000 level courses. Because besides the lectures and tutorials (which sometimes require reading a paper before coming to the class for discussion), there are also two 500 words assignments, one T/F quiz, one short essay-based quiz, a 1500 words paper and a group presentation! I don't know how maria and the TAs can handle marking all these essays and papers because they are just quite a lot haha.

So yeah, I think this course is for those who actually have an interest in the topic and want to learn more. I found it painful to write the essays but do reckon that after going through the painful process, those concepts stay longer in my brain than those light-workload classes (Sorry professors!)
